key_risks: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities leading to data breaches and reputational damage
Regulatory and compliance issues, including overbilling clients and evolving labor laws
Competitive pressures in the HCM software market
Client retention challenges and modest growth in seat additions
controversies: Significant data breach in 2023 resulting in a $900,000 settlement
SEC charge in 2021 for overbilling clients, leading to a $250,000 settlement
social_issues: Potential impact on client trust due to cybersecurity incidents
governance_issues: Weaknesses in internal controls and financial transparency
Need for improved governance to address compliance and cybersecurity risks

sources.title: $900K Settlement Resolves Paycom Payroll Data Breach Lawsuit
sources.snippet: A $900,000 settlement has been reached to resolve a proposed class action lawsuit that claimed inadequate cybersecurity on the part of Paycom Payroll resulted in a data breach between May 28 and June 2, 2023. Don't miss the next class action settlement deadline. Sign up for ClassAction.org's free weekly newsletter.

sources.title: SEC Charges Paycom for Overbilling Clients
sources.snippet: ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING File No. 3-20443. July 30, 2021 - The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced settled charges against Paycom Software, Inc. for violating the books and records and internal accounting controls provisions of the federal securities laws in connection with its overbilling of clients. Paycom has agreed to pay $250,000 to settle the action.
